#Text=Riga/Centrs
#Text=Centrs is a district in Riga , right northeast of the old town .
#Text=In addition to the official Centrs district , this article also includes the northwestermost third of Maskavas Forstate , west of Lacplesa iela .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Centrs is within walking distance ( around a kilometer ) from the Old town and the central railway station .
#Text=It also has the Riga Coach Station to the west of the central railway station , with buses to domestic cities and other EU capitals like Tallinn and Vilnius .
#Text=If you do n't want to walk , trams 3 , 6 and 11 as well as a range of bus and trolley bus lines take you up ; have a look at the public tranportation network maps .
#Text=Monuments and historic buildings near the Freedom Monument
#Text=Freedom Monument , Brivibas iela 1 .
#Text=One of Latvia 's national symbols .
#Text=It was erected during the first independence and surprisingly never taken down by the Soviets ( although laying flowers at its feet was forbidden ) .
#Text=The statue of a woman holding three stars at the top of the monument represents Freedom embracing Latvia 's regions .
#Text=Art Nouveau Buildings .
#Text=Alberta and Elizabetes streets ( iela ) are the best place to see the creations of Art Nouveau architect Eisenstein , famous of his splendid style .
#Text=Other Art Nouveau buildings can be seen in the area around the Freedom Monument , including the embassies on Raina Bulvaris and on Strelnieku iela .
#Text=Kobe Clock ( Western corner of the park ) .
#Text=Donated by Riga 's sister city Kobe in celebration of anniversary of restoration of independence .
#Text=Museums near the Freedom Monument
#Text=Museum ' Jews in Latvia ' and Jewish Community , Skolas 6 , 3rd floor , ☏ +37167283484 , ✉ info@jewishmuseum.lv .
#Text=Su - Th 11:00 - 17:00 , Closed F Sa .
#Text=Small museum dedicated to Jewish life in Latvia since the 16th century .
#Text=Includes information on destruction of the synagogues by the Nazis , and the Latvians that saved Jews during the Holocaust .
#Text=Exhibits are in English and Latvian .
#Text=Free , donations welcomed .
#Text=National Museum of Art , 1 Janis Rozentāls Square , ☏ +37167226467 , ✉ lnmm@lnmm.lv .
#Text=Tu - Th 10:00 - 18:00 , F 10:00 - 20:00 , Sa Su 10:00-17:00. Latvian National Museum of Art is the most significant depository in the nation for works of art .
#Text=Houses many works by Latvian artists .
#Text=Adults € 6 ; students , seniors € 3 .
#Text=Former KGB Building , 61 Brīvības iela , ☏ +37127875692 , ✉ info.kgb@omf.lv .
#Text=M Tu Th F 10:00 - 17:30 , W 12:00 - 19:00 , Sa Su 10:00-16:00. The former KGB building is actually an attractive , ornate historic building at the corner of Brivibas and Stabu .
#Text=It stood empty for years , but for the 2014 celebration of Riga becoming the European Capital of Culture it was revived with a number of artistic initiatives taking place there .
#Text=It is now a branch of the Museum of the Occupation of Latvia , holding a general exhibition about the KGB activities , and guided tours of the cellar where interrogations took place .
#Text=exhibition free , € 5 for a guided tour of the KGB cellar .
#Text=Religious buildings near the Freedom Monument
#Text=Riga Orthodox Cathedral , Brīvības bulvāris 23 , ☏ +37167211207 .
#Text=The Orthodox Cathedral was erected during Russian rule for Russian residents .
#Text=In contrast to its relatively plain exterior , it is spectacular on the inside , but be aware that shorts are not allowed .
#Text=free .
#Text=St. Gertrude Old Church ( Vecā Svētās Ģertrūdes baznīca ) , Ģertrūdes iela 8 , ☏ +37167275707 , ✉ kanceleja@gertrude.lv .

#Text=The brick neogothic church of St. Getrude , despite " old " in its name , is an entirely late 19th-century creation that replaced a series of stone and wooden churches that stood there ( and were repeatedly destroyed due to being outside of the city walls ) since the 15th century .
#Text=The unusual veracity with which the 19th-century architects interpreted the principles of Gothic architecture may make the church pass for an authentic medieval creation , both inside and out .
#Text=St. Gertrude has long-standing links with Riga 's German Lutheran community , and offers religious services in German .
#Text=The Latvian Lutheran community which used to share the church with the German has moved to the " new " St. Getrude church further east down Brīvības Street .
#Text=Free .
#Text=Maskavas
#Text=forštate ( Moscow district )
#Text=Maskavas is the area along the Daugava River east of the train station .
#Text=While Maskavas has a bad reputation due to its high crime rate , buildings in disrepair , and homeless vagrants , it has some of the oldest buildings in Riga .
#Text=The area closest to the city center is being gentrified , although it is not recommended to hang out in parks in Maskavas after dark .
#Text=Religious buildings in Maskavas forštate
#Text=Choral Great Synagogue , At Gogola and Dzirnavu iela .
#Text=Mostly in ruins since the Germans burned it down on July 4 , 1941 with 600 people locked inside .
#Text=There is a memorial to 400 Latvians who saved Jews during the Holocaust .
#Text=Russian Orthodox Church of the Annunciation , Gogola iela 9 .
#Text=Jesus Church , 18 Elijas iela .
#Text=An unusually-designed Lutheran church .
#Text=Viewpoints in Maskavas
#Text=forštate
#Text=Latvian Academy of Sciences , Akademijas laukums 1 , ☏ +37167225361 .
#Text=Balcony open May-Sep : daily 09:00-20:00. Built in 1953 , this building is often called " Stalin 's Birthday Cake " because of its austere yet ornamented design .
#Text=The 17th-floor balcony is open to visitors .
#Text=Entry to the 17th-floor terrace : € 3 .
#Text=Museums in Maskavas forštate
#Text=Riga Ghetto Museum , Maskavas iela 14a ( entrance from Krasta Iela ) , ☏ +371-67791784 , ✉ rgm@rgm.lv .
#Text=Su - Th 10:00 - 18:00 , except Jewish religious holidays .

#Text=The museum , which encompasses a relocated historic wooden house and cobblestones from the Jewish ghetto created by Nazi Germany in occupied Riga during the Second World War , documents both the history of the ghetto and the tragic fates of Riga 's Jewish population who perished in the Holocaust .
#Text=It also attempts to recall Jewish community life from before the war .
#Text=Voluntary donations - € 5 suggested .
#Text=Other
#Text=Red warehouses .
#Text=A huge cluster of mid-19th century warehouses between the train station and Central Market .
#Text=They remind of the former trade harbor .
#Text=Do
#Text=Esplanade Park ( a block from the Freedom Monument ) .
#Text=Designed by Georg Kuphaldt , who was expelled by Germany in 1915 as a spy because he had a telescope in his garden .
#Text=Koncertzāle Ave Sol ( Ave Sol Concert Hall ) , Citadeles 7 .
#Text=Hosts the renowned choral ensemble Ave Sol .
#Text=The hall also plays host to a range of other concert activities .
